pageContext.description: Unornamented. Vestigal shield on face. Slight stops on sides below ridge. Ridge well developed.
pageContext.other: Width: edge 56mm; butt and ridge 27mm,Thickness: flange 31mm
pageContext.associations: With it was found a piece of worked (?) quarts and distinct traces of a fire, at the same level and contemporary.
pageContext.collection: University College Museum, Aberystwyth, 1927,Presented by the finder.,Now National Museum wales,47.164/179
pageContext.site: wales,ceredigion (formerly cardiganshire),upper valnor,ash grange,found by j.d. jenkins 9th april 1927 while digging a drain in the field neat east to ash grange, 2 miles from aberystwyth
pageContext.museumCollection: University College of Wales Museum, Aberystwyth
